abstract.para: UEFI system firmware allows &suse; Linux media and installations to boot.

section.title: Introduction
section.para: &suse; Linux installation media are formatted as UEFI Removable Media and require &armreg; SystemReady compliant boot firmware on the system.

listitem.para: For &nvidia; &jetson; &orin; Nano developer kit: 0.01 in jumper
Second system (e.g., notebook) with USB connection to your &nvidia; based system

section.title: Flashing the firmware
section.para: Follow &nvidia; or OEM provided instructions for flashing your system. &suse; Linux installation will be easiest if boot firmware and operating system do not share the same storage device, i.e., SPI flash for firmware.

step.para: Power on the &nvidia; system and enter Force Recovery Mode (RCM) according to its vendor instructions.
